New-York Historical Society
Sidney Voice collection of cigar bands
Voice, Sidney P., 1906-1982
PR-241
4.36 Linear feet in 8 boxes of chromolithographed cigar bands.
circa 1890-1963 Cigar bands and cigar box labels, most clearly marked with the brand and company of cigar, collected by Sidney P. Voice, vice-president of the Consolidated Lithographing Corporation in Brooklyn, which produced many of these items. The collection includes several salesman's sample books for New York lithographing companies.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Sidney P. Voice, 1973, 1977, and 1983.
Arrangement
The collection is organized by format: Cigar Bands, Cigar Box Labels, Cigar Edgings, and Registration Certificates.
Biographical / Historical
Sidney Voice was the vice-president of Consolidated Lithographing Corporation in Brooklyn.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as: Sidney Voice Collection of Cigar Bands, PR-241, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information
Collection inventoried by Jenny Gotwals and Sandra Markham (August 2004). WORD-document finding aid migrated to ArchivesSpace by Joseph Ditta (July 2020).
Related Materials
Additional cigar labels can be found in the Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera (PR-031), the Ephemera Collection (PR-264), and the Amie Karp Collection of Tobacciana (PR-392). More cigar printing done by the Consolidated Lithographing Corp. can be found in the Kane-Greenberg Collection of Progressive Proof Prints (PR-242).
Scope and Contents
The Sidney Voice Collection of Cigar Bands spans the period from circa 1890 to circa 1963 and contains cigar bands, cigar box labels, and salesman's sample books for New York and Brooklyn lithographers. A few registration certificates for cigar brand names are also included. Cigar bands are housed loose, pasted onto boards, and pasted into albums.
Use Restrictions
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
